SystemBios Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.bios.system_bios.SystemBios(host)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(host)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

_get_einj_bios_settings_filename(manufacturer, model, fs_actions, einj_settings_path, current_bios_ver)[source]¶

To get the BIOS setting’s file name for the respective platform, depending on the device’s BOIS version. If the BIOS version of the device is old

  • einj_bios_settings_<model>_<manufacturer>_old.json

else:

  • einj_bios_settings_<model>_<manufacturer>.json

E.G:

einj_bios_settings_tiogapass_quanta.json

compare_msr_by_group(msr_before, msr_after)[source]¶

Comparison for the MSRs. For each MSR register group,

  1. Check the MSR Status Registers first
    • If not 0, then compare the MSR Addr/Misc to seek for differences.

      – If differences found, log the difference as failure

    • If 0, then ignore the MSR Addr/Misc comparison

  1. Check and compare the MSR Control Registers and log the difference as failure if any

Function to get the address map from idk client @return - addr_map - Dict with address and a map tuple 5-tuple such as (1 1 2 0 1) mapped to a system address 0X304000C100 {u’(1 0 1 0 0 )’: u‘0X3040000000’,u’(1 1 2 0 0 )’: u‘0X3040000100’}

get_current_boot_sequence(curr_bios_dump=None, boot_options_tokens=None)[source]¶

## Use boot_options_tokens passed by users to identify the boot sequence ## setting and return. # @param curr_bios_dump - Use this bios settings dump to check the sequence # @param boot_options_tokens - These are the setup question and token # number to look for if not passed use the # default question and token number # @return - Boot sequence as list

get_diff_in_msr_groups(msr_before, msr_after)[source]¶

MSR registers (400h ~ 44Fh) are grouped. Each group contains 4 registers

  • Control (400h + x*4h)

  • Status (401h + x*4h)

  • Addr (402h + x*4h)

  • Misc (403h + x*4h)

modify_bios_dump(bios_settings, bios_dump_location)[source]¶

## Function to modify the given bios_settings in the dump file # This function will check for options after the matched “Setup Question”. # and also the token number to exactly match the setting # when we find a matching pattern for any setting the change will be # set as passed and the then the setting will be dumped as SCELNX dump # file # returns the changed dump file , and both old and new bios settings
